benchmark_details.name: CUAD-QA
benchmark_details.overview: CUAD-QA is a corpus of 85k question-answer pairs generated over 510 real-world CUAD contract documents, encompassing simple, complex, and summarization-style queries, designed to evaluate the efficacy of the CON-QA framework in securely answering queries while preserving privacy.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The primary objective of CUAD-QA is to evaluate privacy-preserving mechanisms in enterprise legal settings and to explore the privacy-utility trade-offs in cloud-based contract question answering.

data.annotation: The questions were generated using ChatGPT-4o-mini prompted with individual pages from contract documents.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the comparisons with ground-truth answers and through expert evaluations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better privacy preservation without a significant decrease in answer quality and context richness.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through experimental assessments and expert human evaluations.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The framework ensures strong protection of sensitive contractual entities through structured anonymization and session-consistent deanonymization.
